content:
Fast food is widely knowns in most populated countries. Now, fast food has become part of urban people's life because it offers a delicious quick-meal at a small price. However, consuming fast food such as hot dog, hamburger, fried chicken, soft drink, and many others may frequently cause several bad impacts on your health.

In many countries, dieticians often emphasize the dangers of consuming too much fast food. Fast food is high ini in calories but they come from unhealthy fat and added sugars. Therefore, the food provides few nutrients. The imbalanced content from this kind of food may trigger various diseases. Obesity is one of the most possible impacts of consuming too much fast food. Besides, it can also increase the risk of hypertension, heart attack, as well as diabetes.

A study showed that children who consumed a lot fast food had lower IQ than children who ate less fast food. Although the difference was subtle, the study proved that fast food that children consumed at the age between 6 and 24 months gave a small but significant effect on their IQ when they reached 8 years old.

In addition, most fast food meals have the artificial additives and sweetener to maintain their texture consistency, to give them longer shelf-life, and also to enhance the flavor. These subtances contribute to the good taste of fast food.

Pregnant women should also avoid eating fast food. Eating such food is not only bad for the mother herself but also for the baby. The baby will be so vulnerable to hypertension and diabetes. Therefore, we should consult a doctor before consuming fast food. The cause is the preservatives in fast food that are harmful to both mother and her baby. Moreover, a number of studies in China have found that the rate of breast cancer among women has risen due to the consumption of fast food.

The author presents the impacts of fast food on health in paragraph ...
answer: In the second paragraph of the text, numerous examples of health effects due to fast food consumption are given. Thus, the correct answer is B.
raw_answer: Pada paragraf 2 pada teks tersebut banyak memberikan contoh dampak kesehatan karena konsumsi fast food. Jadi, jawaban yang tepat adalah B.

content:
Artificial intelligence (AI) is rapidly entering health care and serving major roles. These include automating routine tasks in medical practice and managing medical resources. As developers create Al systems to take on these tasks, several risks and challenges emerge.

The most obvious risk is that Al systems will sometimes be wrong. This can result in patient injury or other health-care problems. An Al system possibly recommends the wrong drug for a patient of fails to notice a tumor on a radiological scan. Of course, many injuries occur due to medical errof in the health-care system today, even without the involvement of Al. Al errors are potentially different for at least two reasons. First, patients and providers may react differently to injuries resulting from software than from human error. Second, if Al systems become widespread, an underlying problem in one Al system might result in injuries to thousands of patients.

Moreover, training Al systems requires large amounts of data from sources. However, health data are often problematic. Data are typically fragmented across many different systems. Even aside from the variety just mentioned, patients typically see different providers and switch insurance companies. This would lead to data split in multiple systems and multiple formats.

Another set of risks arise around privacy. The requirement of large datasets creates incentives for developers to collet such data from many patients. Some patients may be concerned that this collection may violate their privacy. In fact, lawsuits have been
filed based on data-sharing between large health systems and Al developers.

The integration of \( \mathrm{Al} \) into the health system will undoubtedly change the role of health-care providers. A less hopeful vision is that providers will be enabled to provide more-personalized and better care, freed to spend more time interacting with patients as humans. A less hopeful vision would see providers struggling to weather monsoon of uninterpretable predictions and recommendations from competing algorithms. In either case, medical education will need to prepare providers to evaluate and interpret the Al systems they will encounter in the evolving health-care environment.
The author holds the assumption about Al developers that ...
answer: The correct answer is option A as explained in paragraph 4.
raw_answer: Jawaban yang tepat terdapat pada pilihan A karena dijelaskan dalam paragraf 4 .

content:
Text 1
Every day we chew food with our teeth. We can crush hard food using molars. Our teeth are coated with a protective layer called tooth enamel. This layer is only a few millimeters of food without causing pain to the soft tissues under it.

Scientists believe tooth enamel is the hardest biological tissue in the human body. Dental scientists have done a lot of research to replicate this super thin but strong structure for longer teeth health. Recently materials scientists and chemical engineers have created synthetic tooth enamel that is even stronger than what is found in our teeth. They also studied both to more closely resemble the composition and structure of the real substance.

Tooth enamel is constantly bombarded by the strike of acids and bases from food and drink. It is contending with new bacteria and changes in the mouth's microbiome. Enamel can be strong brushing and habitual teeth grinding. Time, wear and decay bore holes through a tooth's outer layers, resulting in cavities and other dental issues. Unlike a broken bone, enamel's defense itself.

The origin of enamel's strength comes from its complex and intricate structure. Protective minerals are made of tiny, interconnected tubes called nanorods, which are filled with lattice grids, a type of calcium phosphate mineral.
Text 2
Tooth enamel is a hard substance that is found on the outermost part of our teeth. Enamel is considered as the hardest substance in our body. It is known even harder than our bones. How it decays or breaks down when bacteria break down the sugars in foods creating an acid hole. About two percent of enamel is made of some organic materials known as enamelin.

Enamel plays an important role in protecting the tooth's to reduce the discomfort we feel due to hot or cold foods.

Although tooth enamel is a hard and protective coating, it can easily crack. When the enamel breaks, it is no longer able to protect the teeth adequately. Tooth decay and enamel damage and presence of acids in the food we eat. Acids cause erosion of the enamel. Once your tooth enamel is destroyed, your body will not make more of an effort to replace it. Therefore, we should avoid acids.

According to Text 1 , what can damage tooth enamel?
answer: The oral microbiome can be altered by the acids and bases present in the food and drink we consume, as demonstrated in the statement "The tooth enamel is persistently attacked by acids and bases from ingested food and beverages. It has to deal with novel bacteria and shifts in the mouth's microbiome \( e^{n} \). The correct answer is \( \mathrm{D} \).
raw_answer: Asam dan basa dari makanan dan minuman yang dikonsumsi dapat mengubah mikrobioma mulut yang dijelaskan dalam kalimat "Tooth enamel is constantly bombarded by the strike of acids and bases from food and drink. It is contending with new bacteria and changes in the mouth's microbiome \( e^{n} \). Jawaban yang tepat adalah \( \mathrm{D} \).

Pada teks 1 terdapat pernyataan "Recently materials scientists and chemical engineers have created synthetic tooth enamel that is even stronger than what is found in our teeth. This advice is found in the statement "Once your tooth enamel is destroyed, your body will not make more of an effort to replace it. Therefore, we should avoid acids". The correct answer is \( \mathrm{C} \).
raw_answer: Pada teks 2 terdapat saran untuk menghindari konsumsi makanan yang mengandung asam supaya tidak merusak enamel gigi. Saran tersebut ada di pernyataan "Once your tooth enamel is destroyed, your body will not make more of an effort to replace it. Therefore, we should avoid acids". Jawaban yang tepat adalah \( \mathrm{C} \).

content:
Text 1
Every day we chew food with our teeth. We can crush hard food using molars. Our teeth are coated with a protective layer called tooth enamel. This layer is only a few millimeters of food without causing pain to the soft tissues under it.

Scientists believe tooth enamel is the hardest biological tissue in the human body. Dental scientists have done a lot of research to replicate this super thin but strong structure for longer teeth health. Recently materials scientists and chemical engineers have created synthetic tooth enamel that is even stronger than what is found in our teeth. They also studied both to more closely resemble the composition and structure of the real substance.

Tooth enamel is constantly bombarded by the strike of acids and bases from food and drink. It is contending with new bacteria and changes in the mouth's microbiome. Enamel can be strong brushing and habitual teeth grinding. Time, wear and decay bore holes through a tooth's outer layers, resulting in cavities and other dental issues. Unlike a broken bone, enamel's defense itself.

The origin of enamel's strength comes from its complex and intricate structure. Protective minerals are made of tiny, interconnected tubes called nanorods, which are filled with lattice grids, a type of calcium phosphate mineral.
Text 2
Tooth enamel is a hard substance that is found on the outermost part of our teeth. Enamel is considered as the hardest substance in our body. It is known even harder than our bones. How it decays or breaks down when bacteria break down the sugars in foods creating an acid hole. About two percent of enamel is made of some organic materials known as enamelin.

Enamel plays an important role in protecting the tooth's to reduce the discomfort we feel due to hot or cold foods.

Although tooth enamel is a hard and protective coating, it can easily crack. When the enamel breaks, it is no longer able to protect the teeth adequately. Tooth decay and enamel damage and presence of acids in the food we eat. Acids cause erosion of the enamel. Once your tooth enamel is destroyed, your body will not make more of an effort to replace it. Therefore, we should avoid acids.

The definition of tooth enamel can be found in ...
answer: The definition of tooth enamel can be found in paragraph 1 of text 1 and 2. The correct answer is \( \mathrm{A} \).
raw_answer: Definisi enamel gigi dapat ditemukan di paragraf 1 pada teks 1 dan 2 . Jawaban yang tepat adalah \( \mathrm{A} \).

content:
Thread: Kids' Ongoing Stomach
\begin{tabular}{|c|c|}
\hline \begin{tabular}{l} 
Bad Dad 12 \\
Period: \\
September \\
2022, 22:01 PM
\end{tabular} & \begin{tabular}{l} 
Hi, all! I 'am looking for any \\
advice on this and wonder \\
whether anyone has had a \\
similar experience: My 4 years \\
old daughter has been \\
complaining that her tummy \\
hurts. This has now been on and \\
off since August, and it's getting \\
worse as it's starting to hurt a lot \\
now. I've taken her to see the \\
doctor twice. Both times they \\
produced around and concluded \\
that there's nothing to worry \\
about. Surely this isn't right, is it? \\
However, if the doctors won't do \\
anything, there's not much I can \\
do.
\end{tabular} \\
\hline \begin{tabular}{l} 
WestisWest \\
Period: \\
September \\
2022, 23:15 PM
\end{tabular} & \begin{tabular}{l} 
I would go back and ask if it could \\
be constipation or stomach \\
migraines. I wouldn't be happy \\
for them to just overlook it as it is \\
ongoing.
\end{tabular} \\
\hline \begin{tabular}{l} 
Lego Friends \\
Period: 23 \\
September \\
2022, 08:04 \\
AM
\end{tabular} & \begin{tabular}{l} 
Keep a diary of food: process \\
resorts of pain act. Always by \\
using alternative medicine.
\end{tabular} \\
\hline \begin{tabular}{l} 
LiveintheNOW \\
Period: \( \quad 23 \) \\
September \\
2022 , 04:14 \\
AM
\end{tabular} & \begin{tabular}{l} 
My 3 years old was the same, \\
always complaining of pain \\
behind her badly beat son and \\
she ended up in the Accident and \\
Emergency department a few \\
times with virusting/fever/ not \\
passing urine.
\end{tabular} \\
\hline \begin{tabular}{l} 
Suzycat \\
Period: \( \quad 23 \) \\
September \\
\( 2022, \quad 10: 44 \) \\
AM
\end{tabular} & \begin{tabular}{l} 
Someone recommended the 'any \\
symptom diary' app. You can log \\
all your daughter's food, \\
symbiotics, and burst \\
movements via the Bristol stool \\
chart.
\end{tabular} \\
\hline \begin{tabular}{l} 
Michele1980 \\
Period: \( \quad 24 \) \\
September \\
2022, 12:17 \\
AM
\end{tabular} & \begin{tabular}{l} 
It could be anxiety as your \\
daughter might start schooling.
\end{tabular} \\
\hline
\end{tabular}

Who posted the most relevant response to BadDad12's concern regarding doctors' recommendation?
answer: In response, LiveintheNow relayed a story that was nearly identical to what BadDad12 had shared in that thread. Thus, the answer is C.
raw_answer: LiveintheNow merespons dengan menceritakan hal yang hampir sama dengan yang diceritakan BadDad12 dalam thread tersebut. Jadi, jawabannya adalah C.

What is the tone of the thread with regards to the gravel race as a world championship?
answer: Terdapat nuansa ketidakpastian dalam thread ini. Lequack = tidak memiliki pengetahuan tentang gravel race, berkeinginan untuk menonton dan berharap itu mirip dengan cobbled races. Stonerider \( = \) memberikan detail tentang jalur dan alasan emergence dari gravel bike. Cyclingnews = mengklarifikasi aturannya. Red Rick = sangat antusias. Saunaking = optimis bahwa gravel race bukan hanya gimmick. Tobydawq = berkeinginan untuk melihatnya. Jawaban yang benar adalah E.
raw_answer: Tone pada thread tersebut cenderung ada ketidakpastian. Lequack = belum tahu mengenai gravel race, ingin menontonnya dan berharap mirip cobbled races. Stonerider \( = \) memberikan informasi mengenai rutenya dan penyebab muncul gravel bike. Cyclingnews = menjelaskan peraturannya. Red Rick = bersemangat. Saunaking = optimis gravel race bukan gimmick. Tobydawq = ingin menontonnya. Jawaban yang tepat adalah E.

Who provided the most relevant comment on Lequack's concern?
answer: Lequack mengharapkan balap gravel bukan hanya trik belaka dan sebanding dengan balap berbatu yang penuh aksi tanpa adanya tanjakan. Saunaking menanggapi dengan pernyataan "Saya tidak berpikir ini adalah trik karena jelas bertumbuh. UCI telah pada dasarnya menciptakan jalur balap jalan untuk dunia - tanpa pendakian dan gravel yang cukup dari apa yang saya baca. \( { }^{\prime \prime} \). Oleh karena itu, jawaban yang benar adalah \( \mathrm{D} \).
raw_answer: Lequack berharap gravel race bukan gimmick dan mirip dengan cobbled races yang penuh aksi dan tanpa tanjakan. Hal tersebut direspon oleh Saunaking dalam pernyataan "I do not think it is a gimmick since it is definitely growing. UCI has basically created a road race course for the worlds - no climbing and pretty gravel from what I have read. \( { }^{\prime \prime} \). Jadi, jawaban yang tepat adalah \( \mathrm{D} \).

content: Dari 26 huruf alfabet dipilih satu per satu 8 huruf sembarang dengan cara pengembalian dan disusun sehingga membentuk kata. Probabilitas bahwa di antara kata-kata yang terbentuk mengandung subkata "SIMAKUI" dalam satu rangkaian kata yang tidak terpisah adalah ..
answer: Probabilitas terbentuknya subkata SIMAKUI dari 8 huruf adalah \( \frac{52}{26^{8}} \)
raw_answer:
Kemungkinan terbentuknya subkata SIMAKUI dari 8 huruf
\begin{tabular}{|c|c|c|c|c|c|c|c|}
\hline 26 & \( \mathrm{~S} \) & I & \( M \) & A & \( \mathrm{K} \) & \( \mathrm{U} \) & I \\
\hline Atau & & & 8 & & & & \\
\hline \( \mathrm{S} \) & I & \( \mathrm{M} \) & A & \( \mathrm{K} \) & \( \mathrm{U} \) & I & 26 \\
\hline
\end{tabular}

Jadi Probabilitasnya adalah \( \frac{52}{26^{8}} \)

content:
Text 1
Social media advertising is a type of digital marketing that utilizes social networks such as Facebook, Twitter, and Instagram to deliver paid advertisements to your target audience in a quick and effective way to connect with customers and boost your marketing campaigns.

By leveraging various data sources, advertisers are able to hyper target their audiences and deliver personalized content based on demographics and user behavior. When an audience social media advertisers may see more interaction and conversion. Social media advertisements are also cost effective, offering the potential for high rates of return.

Social media advertising is a must if you want to quickly reach new target markets. More and more companies - including the world 's top performing brands- utilize social media companies and reach out to new consumers. To keep up with the competition, we need to learn how these ads work and how they can benefit your company.

Because both the Internet and content marketing are constantly evolving, there are many ways to go about your advertising strategy on social media platforms. The types advertising your preferred platforms and the audience you want to reach.

When considering social media advertising options, such as which advertising platform to use, remember that each platform has its own audience. That means you want to choose customers. If you are already active on social media, pay attention to which platforms perform well and which organic posts get the most interaction to target the best audience.
Text 2
How effective are advertisements on social media advertisements are just one of the innumerable ways to reach consumers today, alongside TV print, podcast, out-of-home advertising, and a long list of other digital channels and guerilla tactics. In the world of advertising, media is more fragmented than it has ever been. When it comes to how effective social media advertising is, the data offers brands some good news "Promisingly \( 26 \% \) of social media users say they tend to buy brands they see advertised."

Clearly, adverts are not the only way for customers to discover brands. However, if you built your strategy around social media advertising, it is crucial to get it right. \( 90 \% \) of consumers globally say they have visited a social network in the past month. Meanwhile, global social media advertising spending is projected to grow \( 15 \% \) annually through 2024 . Nevertheless, with so many social media advertisements spending is projected to grow \( 15 \% \) annually through 2024. Nevertheless, with so many social media advertisements saturating our feeds standing out is key.

So, how exactly can you optimize your brand's social media presence to inspire and engage your audience? Using the latest social media report, we sent out to explore exactly these issues. It starts with a lock on the audience. Around the world, 27\% of social media users say they use social media platforms primarily to research and find products to buy, Gen Z and millennials make up \( 68 \% \) of these using social
media for product discovery. That is surprising, given they are among the heaviest users of social media globally. Unlike their older counterparts, who use social media more moderately, millennials spend over 2.5 hours per day on social media, and Gen Z spend just under 3 hours per day on various platforms. Hence, there are three key things to keep in mind to increase effectiveness and get more bang for your advertising buck. Those are knowing the audience, making social media frictionless, and lastly using social media to inform.

According to Text 1 the aims of using a variety of data sources for advertising are to ...
answer: The first paragraph explains that "By utilizing various data sources, advertisers are able to target their audience and provide personalized content based on demographics and user behavior." Therefore, the correct answer is \( \mathrm{A} \).
raw_answer: Dijelaskan pada paragraf pertama bahwa "Dengan memanfaatkan berbagai sumber data, pengiklan mampu menargetkan audiens mereka dan memberikan konten yang dipersonalisasi berdasarkan demografi dan prilaku pengguna." Sehingga jawaban yang tepat adalah \( \mathrm{A} \).

answer: Paragraf ketiga dalam teks 1 menjelaskan bahwa "Penggunaan iklan media sosial sangat penting jika Anda ingin segera menjangkau pasar target baru." Ini menunjukkan sikap yang mendukung terhadap penggunaan iklan media sosial.
raw_answer: Dijelaskan pada paragraf ke 3 text 1 bahwa "Iklan media sosial adalah suatu keharusan jika Anda mau cepat mencapai target pasar baru." Yang menyatakan atitut yang mendukung terhadap penggunaan iklan social media.

content:
Text 1
Male squid, which mate and then leave, are known for not being good parents. The little, shiny bigfin reef squid, which lives on coral reels all over the world, may be the first squid to care for its young.

Once a bigger male has mated with a female, he stays close to keep other males from mating with her. When the female is ready to lay her fertilized eggs, she looks for a coral crack that is safe from currents and predators. After she has done laying eggs, the male will
protect her for a short time and then move on to mate with other females.

Eduardo Sampaio, a biologist, observed something strange in the Red Sea in Egypt. When the male squid had already paired up, a dominant male would scare off rivals by waving his tentacles and making his skin flash white with black stripes. Then he would leave his mate for a few seconds to swim into a crack where eggs were laid. Sampaio said that it was the first time anything like this had ever happened.

Samantha Cheng, an expert on biodiversity at the American Museum of Natural History in New York City, said that male bigfin reef squid in Indonesia in 2013 did something similar. Nonetheless, it had not been described before in the scientific references about any squid, octopus, or other cephalopod.

In a new paper published in Ecology, Sampaio and Cheng explain the behavior and why they think it is a form of paternal care. "Location probing" is common among species that only have one mate, but paternal care is rare among cephalopods. More research is still needed to know more about this rate phenomenon.
Text 2
How does the colossal squid swim? Nobody has ever seen a live colossal squid swimming, so this is a difficult question to answer. The scientists had to look at how other closely related squid swim and come up with the theory about how the colossal squid moves. Colossal squid are part of the Cranchidae family, known as the glass squids. There are many videos of squid species swimming, including the glass squid.

Cranchiidae or glass squid have a very different outward appearance or morphology from most squid. They have forward-facing eyes, which give them binocular vision. This also means they cannot hold their arms out directly in front as they would not be able to see! Most other squid have eyes on the sides of the sides of the head. They do not have to lift their arms out of their field of vision and can swim with their arms flat.

Most of the time cranchiids hold their arms either up over their heads in the 'cockatoo' position, or down in the 'reverse cockatoo' position. Scientist think that the colossal squid, like other cranchiids, does not usually swim with its arms held flat out. However, there is an on-going debate about whether the colossal squid swims in the 'cockatoo' position or 'reverse cockatoo'.

The team reasoned that if the colossal squid held its arms up in the 'cockatoo' position, the lower arms would be longer, as they would have to reach further to meet the tips of the upper arms. Careful measurement of the colossal squid's arms showed that
the lower arms are longer. The position and direction of the non-swivelling hooks on the arms also suggest that the colossal squid uses the 'cockatoo' position. However, this is all just a hypothesis- until someone sees a colossal squid swimming, we will not know for sure. This is the process of science!

Which of the following is an opinion from Text 1 ?
answer: An opinion is a subjective and relative response or viewpoint on a certain phenomenon. The correct answer is E which states, "The small, glossy, large fin reef squid that inhabits coral reefs globally could possibly be the first creature to nurture its offspring."
raw_answer: Opini merupakan pendapat atau tanggapan mengenai suatu fenomena dan bersifat subjektif serta relatif. Jawaban yang tepat adalah E yaitu "The little, shiny big fin reef squid, which lives in coral reefs all over the world, may be the first animal to care for its young".

Based on the information from Texts 1 and 2, which of the following will most likely happen in the future?
answer: Teks kedua tersebut akan melanjutkan penelitian terkait perilaku bigfin reef squid jantan dan posisi berenang colossal squid yang dijelaskan di akhir paragraf masing-masing teks. Pilihan jawabannya adalah C.

According to Text 1 , how would male squid scare off their enemies?
answer: In paragraph 3, there is a statement, "When the male squid is already in a pair, a dominant male would intimidate competitors by flailing his tentacles and flashing his skin white with black stripes". Thus, the answer is A.
raw_answer: Pada paragraf 3 terdapat pernyataan "When the male squid had already paired up, a dominant male would scare off rivals by waving his tentacles and making his skin flash white with black stripes" . Jadi, jawabannya adalah A.

content:
The nuclear industry is in near-terminal decline world-wide, following its failure to establish itself as a clean, cheap, safe or reliable energy source. The onsgoing crisis in nuclear waste management, in safety and in economic costs has severely undermined the industry's credibility. It is currently desperate to find a valid rationale and justification for renewed state support and funding. It is promoting the claim that as nuclear power station does not emit carbon dioxide, the major greenhouse gas, switching from fossil fuels to nuclear power is the only way to cut Carbon Dioxide (CO2) without radically changing consumption patterns. 

However, even the most perfunctory examination of the issue shows that nuclear power has no role whatever in tackling global climate change. In fact quite the opposite is true; any resources expended on attempting to advance nuclear power as a viable solution would inevitably detract from genuine measures to reduce the threat of global warming.

Nuclear energy produces no greenhouse gases, but it has many drawbacks. Now a radical new technology based on thorium promises what uranium never delivered: abundant, safe and clean energy and a way to burn up old radioactive waste. Named after Thor, the warlike Norse god of thunder, thorium could ironically prove a potent instrument of peace as well as a tool to soothe the world's changing climate. 

With the demand for energy on the increase around the world, and the implications of climate change beginning to strike home, government are increasingly considering nuclear power as possible alternative to burning fossil fuel. A thorium reactor is different. And, on paper at least, this radical new technology could be the key to unlocking a new generation of clean and safe nuclear power. It could prove the circuit-breaker to the two most intractable problems of the 21st century: our insatiable thirst for energy, and the warming of the world's climate.

Which of the following is factual according to the passages above?
answer: Passage A asserts that nuclear power plants don't release carbon dioxide. (pemancar tenaga nuklir tidak memancarkan karbon dioksida) Hence, based on the passages, the fact is B, Nuclear energy does not emit carbon dioxide. (tenaga nuklir tidak memancarkan karbon dioksida)
raw_answer: In passage A stated that nuclear power station does not emit carbon dioxide. (pemancar tenaga nuklir tidak memancarkan karbon dioksida) Therefore, the factual according to the passages is B, Nuclear power emits no carbon dioxide. (tenaga nuklir tidak memancarkan karbon dioksida)

content: Diketahui tiga bilangan membentuk barisan aritmetika dengan perbandingan antara suku ke-2 dan suku pertama adalah 2: 1 . Jika jumlah ketiga bilangan tersebut adalah 18 , maka suku ke-3 adalah ...
answer:
diketahui :
\[
\begin{aligned}
u_{2}: u_{1} & =2: 1 \\
u_{1}+u_{2}+u_{3} & =18
\end{aligned}
\]
ditanyakan :
\[
u_{3}=\cdots
\]
\[
\begin{aligned}
\frac{u_{2}}{u_{1}} & =\frac{2}{1} \\
\frac{a+b}{a} & =2 \\
a+b & =2 a \\
a & =b
\end{aligned}
\]
\[
\begin{aligned}
u_{1}+u_{2}+u_{3} & =18 \\
a+(a+b)+(a+2 b) & =18 \\
a+(a+a)+(a+2 a) & =18 \\
6 a & =18 \\
a & =3
\end{aligned}
\]

Jadi, \( a=b=3 \)
Nilai \( u_{3}=a+2 b=3+2(3)=9 \)
raw_answer:
diketahui :
\[
\begin{aligned}
u_{2}: u_{1} & =2: 1 \\
u_{1}+u_{2}+u_{3} & =18
\end{aligned}
\]
ditanyakan :
\[
u_{3}=\cdots
\]
\[
\begin{aligned}
\frac{u_{2}}{u_{1}} & =\frac{2}{1} \\
\frac{a+b}{a} & =2 \\
a+b & =2 a \\
a & =b
\end{aligned}
\]
\[
\begin{aligned}
u_{1}+u_{2}+u_{3} & =18 \\
a+(a+b)+(a+2 b) & =18 \\
a+(a+a)+(a+2 a) & =18 \\
6 a & =18 \\
a & =3
\end{aligned}
\]

Jadi, \( a=b=3 \)
Nilai \( u_{3}=a+2 b=3+2(3)=9 \)

content: Satu tim yang terdiri atas 12 orang dapat menyelesakan sebuah pekerjaan dalam 12 hari. Bila 4 orang dari tim tersebut tidak dapat bekerja karena sakit, berapa persen pertambahan hari untuk menyelesakan pekerjaan tersebut?
answer:
Kasus perbandingan terbalik
Diketahui: :
12 orang dpt menyelesaikan pekerjaan dalam 12 hari.
Ditanyakan : Bila 8 orang dpt menyelesaikan pekerjaan \( \mathrm{dlm} \) berapa hari?
12 orang \( \rightarrow 12 \) hari
8 orang \( \rightarrow x \) hari

Jadi \( 8 \times x=12 \times 12 \)
\[
x=\frac{144}{8}=18 \text { hari }
\]
jadi bertambah 6 hari dari jadwal semula. Sehingga persentasinya adalah
\[
\text { Persentase hari }=\frac{6}{12} \times 100 \%=50 \%
\]

Jadi \( 8 \times x=12 \times 12 \)
\[
x=\frac{144}{8}=18 \text { hari }
\]
jadi bertambah 6 hari dari jadwal semula. Sehingga persentasinya adalah
\[
\text { Persentase hari }=\frac{6}{12} \times 100 \%=50 \%
\]

content: Umur Ulfa \( \frac{1}{3} \) kali umur Ayahnya. Umur Ibunya \( \frac{5}{6} \) kali umur Ayahnya. Jika umur Ulfa 18 tahun, maka umur Ibunya adalah ....
answer:
U: umur ulfa, A: umur ayah, I: umur ibu
\[
\begin{array}{l}
U=18 \\
U=\frac{1}{3} A \rightarrow 18=\frac{1}{3} A \rightarrow A=54 \\
I=\frac{5}{6} A \rightarrow I=\frac{5}{6}(54)=45
\end{array}
\]
raw_answer:
U: umur ulfa, A: umur ayah, I: umur ibu
\[
\begin{array}{l}
U=18 \\
U=\frac{1}{3} A \rightarrow 18=\frac{1}{3} A \rightarrow A=54 \\
I=\frac{5}{6} A \rightarrow I=\frac{5}{6}(54)=45
\end{array}
\]

answer:
Lambang \( \lceil a\rceil \) menyatakan bilangan bulat terkecil yang lebih besar daripada atau sama dengan bilangan real \( a \). Contoh \( [2,1]=3 \)
\[
\begin{array}{c}
0<|x-1|<2 \\
{[x-1]=1} \\
0<(x-1) \leq 1 \\
1<x \leq 2
\end{array}
\]

Untuk \( 1<x \leq 2 \) diperoleh \( [x+1\rceil=3 \) dan memenuhi \( 1<\lceil x+1]<4 \)

Jadi \( 1<u \leq 2 \)
raw_answer:
Lambang \( \lceil a\rceil \) menyatakan bilangan bulat terkecil yang lebih besar daripada atau sama dengan bilangan real \( a \). Contoh \( [2,1]=3 \)
\[
\begin{array}{c}
0<|x-1|<2 \\
{[x-1]=1} \\
0<(x-1) \leq 1 \\
1<x \leq 2
\end{array}
\]

Untuk \( 1<x \leq 2 \) diperoleh \( [x+1\rceil=3 \) dan memenuhi \( 1<\lceil x+1]<4 \)

Jadi \( 1<u \leq 2 \)

While the United States ranks ninth in the world in the proportion of young adults enrolled in college, we have fallen to 16 th in the world in our share of certificates and degrees awarded to adults ages 25 34 --lagging behind Korea, Canada, Japan and other nations. While more than half of college students graduate within six years, the (2) ... for low-income students is around 25 percent.

Acknowledging these factors early in his administration, President Obama challenged every American to commit to at least one year of higher education or post-secondary training, (3) ... that America would once again have the highest proportion of college graduates in the world by 2020 .

content:
A renewable-energy "oasis" scheduled to be built more may serve as a proving ground for new technologies designed to bring green living to the desert. The planned research center is part of the Sahara Forest Project which does not mean it will be built in Africa. The center is meant to be a small-scale version of massive green complexes that project managers hope to build in deserts around the globe.

Experts are now examining arid sites in Australia, the U.S., the Middle East, and Africa that could support the test facility. "The Sahara Forest Project is a holistic approach for creation of local jobs, food, water, and energy, utilizing relatively simple solutions mimicking design and principles from nature", said Frederic Hauge. For instance, special greenhouses would use hot desert air and seawater, make fresh water for growing crops, solar energy would be collected to generate power, and algae pools would offer a renewable and easily transportable fuel supply. In addition, planting trees near the complex would trap atmospheric greenhouse gases such as carbon dioxide white restoring any natural forest cover that has been lost to drought and timber harvesting. "From my perspective as an environmentalist, this could be a game changer in how we produce biomass for food and energy, and how we are going to provide fresh water for the future", Hauge said.

But not all experts are as enthusiastic about the project. In terms of the reforestation plans, "trying to grow trees in the Sahara desert is not the most appropriate approach", said a forest ecologist at the University of California. After all, even though it was literally green in the past, the Sahara was never heavily forested.
What does the word 'it' in ' ... which does not mean it will be built in Africa'. (paragraph 1) refer to?
answer: The proposed research hub forms a part of the Sahara Forest Project, but it doesn't necessarily imply that it will be erected in Africa \( ^{\text{"}} \). In the mentioned sentence, the word 'it' replaces 'hub'.
raw_answer: "the planned research center is part of the Sahara forest project which does not mean it will be built in Africa \( ^{\text {". }} \). Kata it dalam kalimat tersebut menggantikan kata center.

content:
The benefits of fasting must be preceded by a look at the body's progression when deprived of food. Due to the lack of incoming energy, the body must turn to its own resources, a function called autolysis. Autolysis is the breaking down of fat stores in the body in order to produce energy. The liver is in charge of converting the fats into a chemical called a ketone body, "the metabolic substances acetoacetic acid and betahydroxybutyric acid", and then distributing these bodies throughout the body via the blood stream. "When this fat utilization occurs, free fatty acids are released into the blood stream and are used by the liver for energy." The less one eats, the more the body turns to these stored fats and creates these ketone bodies, the accumulation of which is referred to as ketosis.

Detoxification is the foremost argument presented by advocates of fasting. "Detoxification is a normal body process of eliminating or neutralizing toxins through the colon, liver, kidneys, lungs, lymph glands, and skin." This process is precipitated by fasting because when food is no longer entering the body, the body turns to fat reserves for energy.

A second prescribed benefit of fasting is the healing process that begins in the body during a fast. During a fast energy is diverted away from the digestive system due to its lack of use and towards the metabolism and immune system. The healing process during a fast is precipitated by the body's search for energy sources. Abnormal growths within the body, tumors and the like, do not have the full support of the body's supplies and therefore are more susceptible to autolysis.

In addition, there is a reduction in core body temperature. This is a direct result of the slower metabolic rate and general bodily functions. Following a drop in blood sugar level and using the reserves of glucose found in liver glycogen, the basal metabolic rate (BMR) is reduced in order to conserve as much energy within the body as can be provided. Growth hormones are also released during a fast, due to the greater efficiency in hormone production.

Finally, the most scientifically proven advantage to fasting is the feeling of rejuvenation and extended life expectancy. Part of this phenomenon is caused by a number of the benefits mentioned above. A slower metabolic rate, more efficient protein production, an improved immune system, and the increased production of hormones contributes to this long-term benefit of fasting. In addition to the Human Growth Hormone that is released more frequently during a fast, an anti-aging hormone is also produced more efficiently.

The pronoun "which" (paragraph 1) refers to ....
answer: When we fully read the sentence containing the word 'which', we discover that 'which' refers to the phrase 'ketone bodies' (Reduced food intake results in the body increasingly resorting to its stored fats and producing these ketone bodies, a process known as ketosis when these bodies accumulate).
raw_answer: Jika membaca secara lengkap kalimat yang mengandung kata which tersebut, kita akan menemukan bahwa which merujuk pada frasa ketone bodies (The less one eats, the more the body turns to these stored fats and creates these ketone bodies, the accumulation of which is referred to as ketosis).

content:
Living on an island can have strange effects. On Flores in Indonesia, extinct elephants weighed no more than a large hog, but rats grew as big as cats. These are examples of the island effect, which holds that when food and predators are scarce, big animals shrink and little ones grow. Still, no one is sure whether the same rule explains the most famous example of dwarfing on Flores: the odd extinct hominin called the hobbit, which lived 60,000 to 100,000 years ago and stood about a meter tall.

Now, genetic evidence from modern pygmies on Flores-who are unrelated to the hobbit-confirms that humans, too, are subject to so-called island dwarfing. Flores pygmies differ from their closest relatives on New Guinea and in East Asia in carrying more gene variants that promote short stature. The genetic differences testify to recent evolution-the island rule at work, and they imply that the same force gave the hobbit its short stature.

To explore the pygmies' ancestry, a team of researchers studied the Rampasasa pygmies of Flores, who were on average just 145 centimeters tall. They gathered spit and blood from 32 people and (9) The team found no trace of archaic DNA that could be from the hobbit. Instead, the pygmies were (10)__ The DNA suggested that their ancestors came to Flores in several waves: in the past 50,000 years or so, when modern humans first reached Melanesia; and in the past 5000 years, when settlers came from both East Asia and New Guinea.

The DNA also reflects an environmental shift. It suggests the pigmies' ancestors underwent a big shift in diet after reaching Flores, perhaps eating pygmy elephants or marine foods. The pygmies' DNA is also rich in alleles that linked to short stature. Other East Asians have the same alleles, but at much lower frequencies.

The discovery fits with a recent study suggesting evolution also in favor of short stature in people on the Andaman Islands. Such selection on islands boosts the theory that the hobbit, too, was once a taller species, who dwindled in height over millennia on Flores.

\( \ldots \)
answer: Berdasarkan informasi dalam kalimat berikut yang membicarakan mengenai DNA (Tim tersebut tidak menemukan jejak DNA kuno yang bisa berasal dari hobbit), maka opsi jawaban yang benar adalah ekstraksi DNA mereka.
notes: ini text yang (9) harus nya kaya gini  _(9)_. jadi kenapa soalnya cuma ... (titik tiga), harusnya ngelengkapin text cerita yg _(9)_ itu. dari bukunya begitu
raw_answer: Sesuai dengan informasi di kalimat selanjutnya yang membahas tentang DNA (The team found no trace of archaic DNA that could be from the hobbit), maka pilihan jawaban yang tepat adalah extracted their DNA.

content:
Latin America, extending from the deserts of northern Mexico to the icy wilds of Tierra del Fuego in Chile and Argentina, encompasses many diverse countries and peoples. Though most of these countries are largely Catholic and Spanish-speaking, thanks to a shared history of colonization by Spain, they have at least as many differences as they do similarities with each other. In the United States the terms "Hispanic" and "Latino" (or "Latina" for a woman; sometimes written as "Latinx" to be gender-neutral) __ 12_ in an attempt to loosely group immigrants and their descendants who hail from this part of the world. The terms are often used interchangeably, though the words can convey slightly different connotations. It is important to clarify that the categories refer only to a person's origin and ancestry.

In general, "Latino" is understood as a shorthand for the Spanish word latino-americano and refers to anyone born in or with ancestors from Latin America and living in the U.S., _ 13__ Brazilians. "Latino" does not include speakers of Romance languages from Europe, such as Italians or Spaniards, and some people have argued that it excludes Spanish speakers from the Caribbean.

\( \ldots \)
answer: The sentence "In general, "Latino" is comprehended as a condensed form of the Spanish term latinoamericano and it represents anyone born in or with forefathers from Latin America and residing in the U.S., _ 13__ Brazilians. "Latino" does not encompass speakers of..." implies that Brazilian Latinos are part of latino-americano, hence the appropriate word is including (termasuk).
notes: ini text yang (13) harus nya kaya gini  _(13)_. jadi kenapa soalnya cuma ... (titik tiga), harusnya ngelengkapin text cerita yg _(13)_ itu. dari bukunya begitu
raw_answer: Pada kalimat "In general, "Latino" is understood as a shorthand for the Spanish word latinoamericano and refers to anyone born in or with ancestors from Latin America and living in the U.S., _ 13__ Brazilians. "Latino" does not include speakers of...", menunjukkan bahwa Latino Brazil termasuk bagian dari latino-americano, sehingga kata yang tepat adalah including (termasuk)

content:
In the highlands of Northern Thailand, there was once a truly isolated tribe They are known and famously called as phi (spirit/ghost) They lived deep in the forest, completely isolated from outsiders ..... And they leave behind their "windscreens" made of bana leaves.

These people call themselves Miaq Briq or Mlabri which means " forest human being in the Austroasiatic group of languages. They are one of the smallest ethnic groups in the world. For many years, the Mlabri were scattered throughout the forests, existing as nomadic hunter - gatherers. They hunted wild animals by spear and hand-spade and gathered wild plants and fruits.

Due to their traditional subsistence through hunting and gathering, the Mlabri are often considered "living fossils" -but this is an inaccurate characterisation. A recent genetic study found that the Mlabri were established about 500 to 800 years ago, from a very small number of individuals who engaged in agriculture.

Over three decades, significant social changes have taken place within the community, as a result of large-scale deforestation, which occurred at the end of World War II, along with a state-led policy, which has been conducted since the mid-1980s. Today, they lead sedentary lives, engaging in wage labour, cash crop cultivation, and ethnic tourism.

One could ask: How much would the world change without the Mlabri? An example will suffice to answer this question. The word " jealousy " does not exist in their language, which is to say that they have never been envious of others. Yet today, this is no longer the case. As they are integrated into That society under the banner of development, young Mlabri in particular have begun to understand the modern world and have started to express this feeling. They now have a measure to compare themselves with others. Thus, some Mlabri youths, aware that they are disadvantaged in all possible ways, are finding it increasingly difficult to see their position within Thai society in a positive light.
Which of the following sentences can complete the missing sentence in paragraph 1 ?
answer: The sentence that can complete the blank in the first paragraph is "Once outsiders tried to approach them, they instantly vanished into the forest" because the previous sentence explains that this tribe is truly isolated from the outside world.
raw_answer: Kalimat yang bisa melengkapi bagian rumpang di paragraf pertama adalah Once outsiders attempted to approach them, they immediately disoppear into the forest karena kalimat sebelumnya menjelaskan bahwa suku ini benarbenar mengisolasi dari dari dunia luar.

content:
The pandemic resulted in global wealth taking a significant dip in the first part of 2020. By the end of March, global household wealth had already declined by around \( 44 \% \). Interestingly, after much monetary and fiscal stimulus from governments around the world, global household wealth was more than able to recover, finishing up the year at \( \$ 418.3 \) trillion, a \( 7.4 \% \) gain from the previous year. Using data from Credit Suisse, the graphic looks at how global wealth is distributed among the adult population

While individuals worth more than \( \$ 1 \) million constitute just \( 1.1 \% \) of the world's population, they hold \( 45.8 \% \) of global wealth. On the other end of the spectrum, \( 55 \% \) of the population owns only \( 1.3 \% \) of global wealth, and between these two extreme wealth distribution cases, the rest of the world's population has a combined \( 52.8 \% \) of the wealth.

While wealth inequality is especially evident within the wealth ranges mentioned above, these differences can also be seen on a more regional basis between countries. In 2020, total wealth rose by \( \$ 12.4 \) trillion in North America and \$9.2 trillion in Europe. These two regions accounted for the bulk of the wealth gains, with China adding another \( \$ 4.2 \) trillion and the Asia - Pacific region (excluding China and India) another \( \$ 4.7 \) trillion. India and Latin America both recorded losses in 2020. Total wealth fell in India by \( \$ 594 \) billion, or \( 4.4 \% \). Meanwhile, Latin America appears to have been the worst-performing region, with total wealth dropping by \( 11.4 \% \) or \( \$ 1.2 \) trillion.

Despite the burden of COVID-19 on the global economy, the world can expect robust GDP growth in the coming years, especially in 2021. The latest estimates by the International Monetary Fund in April 2021 suggest that global GDP in 2021 will total \( \$ 100.1 \)
trillion in nominal terms, up by \( 4.1 \% \) compared to last year.

The link in normal times between GDP growth and household wealth growth, combined with the expected rapid return of economic activity to its prepandemic levels, suggest that global wealth could grow again at a fast pace. According to Credit Suisse estimates, global wealth may rise by \( 39 \% \) over the next five years. Low and middle-income countries which are responsible for \( 42 \% \) of the growth will also play an essential role in the coming year, even though the account for just \( 33 \% \) of current wealth. The word "its" in paragraph 5 refers to ....
answer: Dari kalimat pembuka paragraf kelima, kita bisa mengetahui bahwa kata ganti 'its' merujuk kepada frasa 'the link in the normal time's'.
raw_answer: Dari kalimat awal paragraf kelima, dapat diketahui bahwa kata ganti its merujuk pada frasa the link in the normal time's.

content:
Researchers found that parents and toodlers who read paper books together, speak and interact more when compared with those who read e-books. Reading with a child is a hugely important developmental activity. It helps youngsters learn new words. It will broaden their knowledge. It also provides time to bond with loved ones. So, scientists wanted to see if parents and children acted differently when they read books together using traditional media versus electronic devices like tablets.

The researchers recruited 37 pairs of parents and healthy toddlers between two and three years old. They asked them to read from three different types of media. These were enhanced electronic books with sound effects or animation, a basic electronic book, and a print book.

Researchers found parents and toodlers spoke more when interacting with a paper book rather than a story on an electronic tablet. Parents used richer language when using print books compared with tablets. They collaborated more with their children. But when reading e-books, parents were less responsive. Children were less engaged with their parents.

In the passage there is a statement like this: Researchers found that parents and toodlers who read paper books together, speak and interact more when compared with those who read \( e \) books.

If children ... print books with their parents, they will communicate more.
answer: The correct choice is A because "read" is the first verb typically used in the simple present tense.
raw_answer:
Conditional sentence \( \rightarrow \) if + simple present tense + simple future tense.

Pilihan yang tepat adalah A karena "read" merupakan kata kerja pertama yang biasa digunakan dalam simple present tense.

content:
A Over this decade, employment in jobs requiring education beyond a high school diploma will grow more rapidly than employment in jobs that do not; of the 30 fastest growing occupations, more than half require post-secondary education. With the average of college graduates at a level that is twice as high as workers with only a high school diploma, higher education is now the clearest (1) ... into the middle class.

In higher education, the U.S. has been outpaced internationally. While the United States ranks ninth in the world in the proportion of young adults enrolled in college, we have fallen to 16 th in the world in our share of certificates and degrees awarded to adults ages 25 34 --lagging behind Korea, Canada, Japan and other nations. While more than half of college students graduate within six years, the (2) ... for low-income students is around 25 percent.

Acknowledging these factors early in his administration, President Obama challenged every American to commit to at least one year of higher education or post-secondary training, (3) ... that America would once again have the highest proportion of college graduates in the world by 2020 .

The option that best completes (3) is ....
answer: "The chief executive has established a fresh educational objective for the nation, in which America will once again hold the record for the greatest number of university graduates worldwide by the year 2020." (Presiden telah menetapkan tujuan pendidikan baru bagi negara ini, dimana Amerika sekali lagi akan memegang rekor untuk jumlah lulusan universitas terbanyak di dunia pada tahun 2020).

(Presiden telah menyusun strategi dalam hal pendidikan untuk negara dan pada hakikatnya Amerika masih memiliki jumlah lulusan mahasiswa tertinggi di dunia pada tahun 2020).

content:
The present study sought to document the word reading and comprehension levels attained by children who were implanted by 5 year of age. It was hypothesized that the improved speech perception abilities acquired with cochlear implantation would promote phonological coding skills. (1) ...

Three subtests of diagnostic reading assessment batteries standardized on hearing children were administered to 181 children between 8 year 0 month and 9 year 11 month of age who had 4 to 6 years of implant experience. (2) .... It included a lexical decision task, a rhyme task, and the digit span subtest of the Wechsler Intelligence Scale for Children.

Over half of the children scored within the average range for their age compared with the normative data for hearing children. (3) ... . They were higher nonverbal intelligence, higher family socioeconomic status, and later onset of deafness between birth and 36 months.

Which option best completes (1)?
answer: The first paragraph essentially articulates the research background on children with hearing aid implants. Therefore, the appropriate additional sentence would be "The goal of the research was to assess the reading abilities of the participants."
raw_answer: paragraf pertama secara garis besar menyatakan latar belakang penelitian terhadap anak-anak yang memiliki implan alat bantu pendengaran. Sehingga kalimat pelengkap yang tepat adalah "The objective of the study was to see the subjects' reading skills."

Hence, the most suitable completion for the Option is \( C \), associating reading competence with three factors.

content:
Living on an island can have strange effects. On Flores in Indonesia, extinct elephants weighed no more than a large hog, but rats grew as big as cats. These are examples of the island effect, which holds that when food and predators are scarce, big animals shrink and little ones grow. Still, no one is sure whether the same rule explains the most famous example of dwarfing on Flores: the odd extinct hominin called the hobbit, which lived 60,000 to 100,000 years ago and stood about a meter tall.

Now, genetic evidence from modern pygmies on Flores-who are unrelated to the hobbit-confirms that humans, too, are subject to so-called island dwarfing. Flores pygmies differ from their closest relatives on New Guinea and in East Asia in carrying more gene variants that promote short stature. The genetic differences testify to recent evolution-the island rule at work, and they imply that the same force gave the hobbit its short stature.

To explore the pygmies' ancestry, a team of researchers studied the Rampasasa pygmies of Flores, who were on average just 145 centimeters tall. They gathered spit and blood from 32 people and (9) The team found no trace of archaic DNA that could be from the hobbit. Instead, the pygmies were (10)__ The DNA suggested that their ancestors came to Flores in several waves: in the past 50,000 years or so, when modern humans first reached Melanesia; and in the past 5000 years, when settlers came from both East Asia and New Guinea.

The DNA also reflects an environmental shift. It suggests the pigmies' ancestors underwent a big shift in diet after reaching Flores, perhaps eating pygmy elephants or marine foods. The pygmies' DNA is also rich in alleles that linked to short stature. Other East Asians have the same alleles, but at much lower frequencies.

The discovery fits with a recent study suggesting evolution also in favor of short stature in people on the Andaman Islands. Such selection on islands boosts the theory that the hobbit, too, was once a taller species, who dwindled in height over millennia on Flores.

\( \ldots \)
answer: The term "related" is an adjective, so it can be enhanced with "most" (an adjective) and "closely" (an adverb) at the beginning as an explainer or modifier.
notes: ini text yang (10)__ harus nya kaya gini  _(10)_. jadi kenapa soalnya cuma ... (titik tiga), harusnya ngelengkapin text cerita yg _(10)_ itu. dari bukunya begitu
raw_answer: Kata related merupakan adjective, sehingga bisa ditambahkan most (adjective) dan closely (adverb) di awalnya sebagai penjelas atau modifier.

This Sentence "This suggests natural selection favored existing genes for shortness while the pygmies' ancestors were on Flores." Should be ....
answer: The sentence "This implies that natural selection promoted pre-existing genes for short stature when the predecessors of the pygmies were on Flores" is aptly positioned at the end of paragraph 4 as it aligns with the context of that paragraph which discusses environmental changes in relation to natural selection.
raw_answer: Kalimat "This suggests natural selection favored existing genes for shortness while the pygmies' ancestors were on Flores" sangat tepat diletakkan di akhir paragraf 4 karena sesuai dengan konteks paragraf tersebut yang menjelaskan tentang perubahan lingkungan yang berkaitan dengan seleksi alam.

content:
Latin America, extending from the deserts of northern Mexico to the icy wilds of Tierra del Fuego in Chile and Argentina, encompasses many diverse countries and peoples. Though most of these countries are largely Catholic and Spanish-speaking, thanks to a shared history of colonization by Spain, they have at least as many differences as they do similarities with each other. In the United States the terms "Hispanic" and "Latino" (or "Latina" for a woman; sometimes written as "Latinx" to be gender-neutral) __ 12_ in an attempt to loosely group immigrants and their descendants who hail from this part of the world. The terms are often used interchangeably, though the words can convey slightly different connotations. It is important to clarify that the categories refer only to a person's origin and ancestry.

In general, "Latino" is understood as a shorthand for the Spanish word latino-americano and refers to anyone born in or with ancestors from Latin America and living in the U.S., _ 13__ Brazilians. "Latino" does not include speakers of Romance languages from Europe, such as Italians or Spaniards, and some people have argued that it excludes Spanish speakers from the Caribbean.

\( \ldots \)
answer: Upon examining the sentence \( { }^{\mu} \) "In the United States, the terms "Hispanic" and "Latino" (or "Latina" for a female; occasionally written as "Latin \( x " \) for gender neutrality) __ 12 to broadly categorize immigrants and their offspring originating from this region of the globe." The subject of this sentence is non-human (the terms) hence the correct response is the passive form of present tense (is/are + V3), which is 'are adopted'.
raw_answer:
Apabila kita amati pada kalimat \( { }^{\mu} \) In the United States, the terms "Hispanic" and "Latino" (or "Latina" for a woman; sometimes written as "Latin \( x " \) to be gender-neutral) __ 12 in an
attempt to loosely group immigrants and their descendants who hail from this part of the world. ". Subyek kalimat adalah non manusia (the termsistilah) sehingga jawaban yang tepat adalah bentuk pasif present tense (is/are + V3) yaitu are adopted.

content:
Hypebeast is defined by Urban Dictionary as: "A kid that collects clothing, shoes, and accessories for the sole purpose of impressing others". Some people accept that hypebeast is a slang for someone who is a "beast" (or obsessed) about hyped-up fashion brands. Thus, they will enact whatever means to achieve that hype. The term has been attributed to (usually) welloff youths, who are obsessed in purchasing popular and high-end streetwear brands. They camp out overnight to await the next sneaker release from famous streetwear brands. On the other hand, they ignore brands that haven't been hyped up online. They also constantly show off their sneaker and snapback collections.

These people spend much of their time curating their social media image by projecting to certain lifestyle. They love to post pictures of their outfits of the day, or OOTD, and count the likes. However, it's commonly considered as an insult to be called a hypebeast, because it is generally the urban version of a "social climber".

According to the passage, hypebeasts dedicate time to ... their social media persona in order to escalate their social status.
answer: The correct answer is B, which is the one you should pay the most attention to. So, the appropriate response is B.
raw_answer: Focus on maknanya give most attention to. Jadi, jawaban yang tepat adalah B.

content:
Text 1
Male squid, which mate and then leave, are known for not being good parents. The little, shiny bigfin reef squid, which lives on coral reels all over the world, may be the first squid to care for its young.

Once a bigger male has mated with a female, he stays close to keep other males from mating with her. When the female is ready to lay her fertilized eggs, she looks for a coral crack that is safe from currents and predators. After she has done laying eggs, the male will protect her for a short time and then move on to mate with other females.

Eduardo Sampaio, a biologist, observed something strange in the Red Sea in Egypt. When the male squid had already paired up, a dominant male would scare off rivals by waving his tentacles and making his skin flash white with black stripes. Then he would leave his mate for a few seconds to swim into a crack where eggs were laid. Sampaio said that it was the first time anything like this had ever happened.

Samantha Cheng, an expert on biodiversity at the American Museum of Natural History in New York City, said that male bigfin reef squid in Indonesia in 2013 did something similar. Nonetheless, it had not been described before in the scientific references about any squid, octopus, or other cephalopod.

In a new paper published in Ecology, Sampaio and Cheng explain the behavior and why they think it is a form of paternal care. "Location probing" is common among species that only have one mate, but paternal care is rare among cephalopods. More research is still needed to know more about this rate phenomenon.
Text 2
How does the colossal squid swim? Nobody has ever seen a live colossal squid swimming, so this is a difficult question to answer. The scientists had to look at how other closely related squid swim and come up with the theory about how the colossal squid moves. Colossal squid are part of the Cranchidae family, known as the glass squids. There are many videos of squid species swimming, including the glass squid.

Cranchiidae or glass squid have a very different outward appearance or morphology from most squid. They have forward-facing eyes, which give them binocular vision. This also means they cannot hold their arms out directly in front as they would not be able to see! Most other squid have eyes on the sides of the sides of the head. They do not have to lift their arms out of their field of vision and can swim with their arms flat.

Most of the time cranchiids hold their arms either up over their heads in the 'cockatoo' position, or down in the 'reverse cockatoo' position. Scientist think that the colossal squid, like other cranchiids, does not usually swim with its arms held flat out. However, there is an on-going debate about whether the colossal squid swims in the 'cockatoo' position or 'reverse cockatoo'.

The team reasoned that if the colossal squid held its arms up in the 'cockatoo' position, the lower arms would be longer, as they would have to reach further to meet the tips of the upper arms. Careful measurement of the colossal squid's arms showed that the lower arms are longer. The position and direction of the non-swivelling hooks on the arms also suggest that the colossal squid uses the 'cockatoo' position. However, this is all just a hypothesis- until someone sees a colossal squid swimming, we will not know for sure. This is the process of science!

According to the text, information about unusual squid's movement found by scientists can be found in ...
answer: The unusual squid movement observed by scientists is found in the statements "Eduardo Sampaio, a biologist, noticed something peculiar in the Red Sea in Egypt" and "Researchers believe that the colossal squid, akin to other cranchiids, doesn't typically swim with its arms fully extended". The correct answer is \( \mathrm{D} \).
raw_answer: Pergerakan cumi-cumi yang tidak biasa yang ditemukan oleh ilmuwan ada pada pernyataan "Eduardo Sampaio, a biologist, observed something strange in the Red Sea in Egypt" dan "Scientist think that the colossal squid, like other cranchiids, does not usually swim with its arms held flat out". Jawaban yang tepat adalah \( \mathrm{D} \).

content: Diketahui fungsi \( f \) dan \( g \) dengan \( g(x)=f\left(x^{2}+2\right) \). Jika diketahui bahwa \( g^{\prime}(1)= \) 8 , maka nilai \( f^{\prime}(3) \) adalah ....
answer:
Diberikan:
\[
\begin{array}{l}
g^{\prime}(1)=8 \\
g(x)=f\left(x^{2}+2\right)
\end{array}
\]

Ditanyakan \( f^{\prime}(3)= \) ?
\[
\begin{array}{l}
g(x)=f\left(x^{2}+2\right) \text { diturunkan } \\
g^{\prime}(x)=f^{\prime}\left(x^{2}+2\right) \cdot 2 x
\end{array}
\]

Untuk \( x=1 \) maka diperoleh
\[
\begin{array}{l}
g^{\prime}(1)=f^{\prime}\left(1^{2}+2\right) \cdot 2(1) \\
8=f^{\prime}(3) \cdot 2 \\
f^{\prime}(3)=4
\end{array}
\] 

Jadi, \( f^{\prime}(3)=4 \).
raw_answer:
Diketahui :
\[
\begin{array}{l}
g^{\prime}(1)=8 \\
g(x)=f\left(x^{2}+2\right)
\end{array}
\]

Ditanyakan \( f^{\prime}(3)= \) ?
\[
\begin{array}{l}
g(x)=f\left(x^{2}+2\right) \text { diturunkan } \\
g^{\prime}(x)=f^{\prime}\left(x^{2}+2\right) \cdot 2 x
\end{array}
\]

Untuk \( x=1 \) aka diperoleh
\[
\begin{array}{l}
g^{\prime}(1)=f^{\prime}\left(1^{2}+2\right) \cdot 2(1) \\
8=f^{\prime}(3) \cdot 2 \\
f^{\prime}(3)=4
\end{array}
\]

content: Kolam renang berbentuk gabungan persegi panjang dan setengah lingkaran seperti gambar berikut. Keliling kolam renang sama dengan \( a \) satuan panjang. Agar luas kolam renang maksimum, maka \( x=\ldots \). Satuan panjang
Grafik fungsi \( f(x)=4 x^{3}+2 x^{2}-8 x+4 \) turun pada ...
answer:
The condition for the graph of \( f(x)=4 x^{3}+2 x^{2}-8 x+4 \) to be decreasing is \( f^{\prime}(x)<0 \)
\[
\begin{array}{r}
f^{\prime}(x)<0 \\
12 x^{2}+4 x-8<0 \\
3 x^{2}+x-2<0 \\
(3 x-2)(x+1)<0 \\
x=\frac{2}{3} \text { or } x=-1 \\
-1<x<\frac{2}{3}
\end{array}
\]

The graph of \( f(x)=4 x^{3}+2 x^{2}-8 x+4 \) is decreasing when \( x \) is between -1 and \(\frac{2}{3}\).
raw_answer:
Syarat grafik \( f(x)=4 x^{3}+2 x^{2}-8 x+4 \) turun adalah \( f^{\prime}(x)<0 \)
\[
\begin{array}{r}
f^{\prime}(x)<0 \\
12 x^{2}+4 x-8<0 \\
3 x^{2}+x-2<0 \\
(3 x-2)(x+1)<0 \\
x=\frac{2}{3} \text { atau } x=-1 \\
-1<x<\frac{2}{3}
\end{array}
\]

answer: "have to" dan "must" bermakna sama. Namun, "must" memiliki nuansa keharusan, sementara "have to" lebih fleksibel dan sesuai dengan kondisi. Oleh karena itu, jawaban yang benar adalah A.

answer: In the first paragraph, there's a statement saying "Some individuals agree that hypebeast is a term used to refer to someone who is extremely fascinated or 'beast' about high-profile fashion labels". The word 'obsessed' implies a sense of compulsion. Therefore, the correct response can be found in option B, which is 'must'.
raw_answer: Pada paragraf 1 terdapat pernyataan "Some people accept that hypebeast is a slang for someone who is a "beast" (or obsessed) about hyped-up fashion brands". Terobsesi berarti merasa wajib. Maka jawaban yang tepat terdapat pada pilihan B yaitu "must".

content:
Hypebeast is defined by Urban Dictionary as: "A kid that collects clothing, shoes, and accessories for the sole purpose of impressing others". Some people accept that hypebeast is a slang for someone who is a "beast" (or obsessed) about hyped-up fashion brands. Thus, they will enact whatever means to achieve that hype. The term has been attributed to (usually) welloff youths, who are obsessed in purchasing popular and high-end streetwear brands. They camp out overnight to await the next sneaker release from famous streetwear brands. On the other hand, they ignore brands that haven't been hyped up online. They also constantly show off their sneaker and snapback collections.

These people spend much of their time curating their social media image by projecting to certain lifestyle. They love to post pictures of their outfits of the day, or OOTD, and count the likes. However, it's commonly considered as an insult to be called a hypebeast, because it is generally the urban version of a "social climber".

Hypebeasts ... with hyped-up fashion brands would ignore brands that are not hyped up on line.
answer: The correct answer is option B because it uses an adjective to describe "hypebeasts".
raw_answer: Jawaban yang tepat terdapat pada pilihan B karena menggunakan kata sifat (adjective) yang menjelaskan "hypebeasts".

content:
Text 1
Every day we chew food with our teeth. We can crush hard food using molars. Our teeth are coated with a protective layer called tooth enamel. This layer is only a few millimeters of food without causing pain to the soft tissues under it.

Scientists believe tooth enamel is the hardest biological tissue in the human body. Dental scientists have done a lot of research to replicate this super thin but strong structure for longer teeth health. Recently materials scientists and chemical engineers have created synthetic tooth enamel that is even stronger than what is found in our teeth. They also studied both to more closely resemble the composition and structure of the real substance.

Tooth enamel is constantly bombarded by the strike of acids and bases from food and drink. It is contending with new bacteria and changes in the mouth's microbiome. Enamel can be strong brushing and habitual teeth grinding. Time, wear and decay bore holes through a tooth's outer layers, resulting in cavities and other dental issues. Unlike a broken bone, enamel's defense itself.

The origin of enamel's strength comes from its complex and intricate structure. Protective minerals are made of tiny, interconnected tubes called nanorods, which are filled with lattice grids, a type of calcium phosphate mineral.
Text 2
Tooth enamel is a hard substance that is found on the outermost part of our teeth. Enamel is considered as the hardest substance in our body. It is known even harder than our bones. How it decays or breaks down when bacteria break down the sugars in foods creating an acid hole. About two percent of enamel is made of some organic materials known as enamelin.

Enamel plays an important role in protecting the tooth's to reduce the discomfort we feel due to hot or cold foods.

Although tooth enamel is a hard and protective coating, it can easily crack. When the enamel breaks, it is no longer able to protect the teeth adequately. Tooth decay and enamel damage and presence of acids in the food we eat. Acids cause erosion of the enamel. Once your tooth enamel is destroyed, your body will not make more of an effort to replace it. Therefore, we should avoid acids.
The word "It" in Text 2 Paragraph 1 refers to ...
answer: The pronoun "it" refers to tooth enamel, which is identified from the statement "The outermost part of our teeth is covered by a hard substance called tooth enamel. This enamel is recognized as the most solid material in our body, and it's even tougher than our bones". The correct answer is B.
raw_answer: Pronoun "it" merujuk pada enamel gigi yang diketahui dari pernyataan "Tooth enamel is a hard substance that is found on the outermost part of our teeth. Enamel is considered as the hardest substance in our body. It is known even harder than our bones". Jawaban yang tepat adalah B.

content:
Text 1
Male squid, which mate and then leave, are known for not being good parents. The little, shiny bigfin reef squid, which lives on coral reels all over the world, may be the first squid to care for its young.

Once a bigger male has mated with a female, he stays close to keep other males from mating with her. When the female is ready to lay her fertilized eggs, she looks for a coral crack that is safe from currents and predators. After she has done laying eggs, the male will protect her for a short time and then move on to mate with other females.

Eduardo Sampaio, a biologist, observed something strange in the Red Sea in Egypt. When the male squid had already paired up, a dominant male would scare off rivals by waving his tentacles and making his skin flash white with black stripes. Then he would leave his mate for a few seconds to swim into a crack where eggs were laid. Sampaio said that it was the first time anything like this had ever happened.

Samantha Cheng, an expert on biodiversity at the American Museum of Natural History in New York City, said that male bigfin reef squid in Indonesia in 2013 did something similar. Nonetheless, it had not been described before in the scientific references about any squid, octopus, or other cephalopod.

In a new paper published in Ecology, Sampaio and Cheng explain the behavior and why they think it is a form of paternal care. "Location probing" is common among species that only have one mate, but paternal care is rare among cephalopods. More research is still needed to know more about this rate phenomenon.
Text 2
How does the colossal squid swim? Nobody has ever seen a live colossal squid swimming, so this is a difficult question to answer. The scientists had to look at how other closely related squid swim and come up with the theory about how the colossal squid moves. Colossal squid are part of the Cranchidae family, known as the glass squids. There are many videos of squid species swimming, including the glass squid.

Cranchiidae or glass squid have a very different outward appearance or morphology from most squid. They have forward-facing eyes, which give them binocular vision. This also means they cannot hold their arms out directly in front as they would not be able to see! Most other squid have eyes on the sides of the sides of the head. They do not have to lift their arms out of their field of vision and can swim with their arms flat.

Most of the time cranchiids hold their arms either up over their heads in the 'cockatoo' position, or down in the 'reverse cockatoo' position. Scientist think that the colossal squid, like other cranchiids, does not usually swim with its arms held flat out. However, there is an on-going debate about whether the colossal squid swims in the 'cockatoo' position or 'reverse cockatoo'.

The team reasoned that if the colossal squid held its arms up in the 'cockatoo' position, the lower arms would be longer, as they would have to reach further to meet the tips of the upper arms. Careful measurement of the colossal squid's arms showed that the lower arms are longer. The position and direction of the non-swivelling hooks on the arms also suggest that the colossal squid uses the 'cockatoo' position. However, this is all just a hypothesis- until someone sees a colossal squid swimming, we will not know for sure. This is the process of science!

The word "they" in Text 2 paragraph 4 refers to ...
answer: According to the assertion "The squad deduced that if the gigantic squid kept its limbs aloft in the 'cockatoo' stance, the bottom limbs would be extended, as they would need to stretch more to touch the end of the top limbs". Hence, the correct response is B.
raw_answer: Sesuai pernyataan "The team reasoned that if the colossal squid held its arms up in the 'cockatoo' position, the lower arms would be longer, as they would have to reach further to meet the tips of the upper arms". Jadi, jawaban yang tepat adalah B.

content:
Jika \( m \) dan \( n \) bilangan real dan fungsi
\[
\begin{array}{l}
f(x)=m x^{3}+2 x^{2}-n x+5 \text { memenuhi } f^{\prime}(1)= \\
f^{\prime}(-5)=0, \text { maka } 3 m-n=\cdots
\end{array}
\]
answer:
Given:
\[
\begin{array}{l}
f(x)=m x^{3}+2 x^{2}-n x+5 \\
f^{\prime}(1)=f^{\prime}(5)=0
\end{array}
\]

Asked:
\[
\begin{array}{l}
3 m-n=\text { ? } \\
\begin{aligned}
f(x) & =m x^{3}+2 x^{2}-n x+5 \\
f^{\prime}(x) & =3 m x^{2}+4 x-n
\end{aligned}
\end{array}
\]

Therefore,
\[
\begin{aligned}
f^{\prime}(1) & =3 m(1)^{2}+4(1)-n \\
0 & =3 m+4-n \\
3 m-n & =-4
\end{aligned}
\]

Answer: 
\[
3 m-n=-4
\]

content:
Jika \( \operatorname{taman} X \) dipelihara cengan baik maka taman tersebut bersih dan indah.

Taman yang menarik untuk dikunjungi adalah taman yang bersih dan indah.
answer:
Jika taman \( X \) dikelola dengan baik, maka taman tersebut menjadi tempat yang menarik untuk dikunjungi.

\[
\begin{array}{c}
p \rightarrow q \\
q \rightarrow r \\
\hline p \rightarrow r
\end{array}
\]

Jika taman \( X \) dirawat dengan baik, maka taman tersebut menjadi tempat yang layak untuk dikunjungi.
raw_answer:
Jika \( \operatorname{taman} \mathrm{X} \) dipelihara dengan bais maka taman tersebut bersih dan indah.

Taman yang menarik untuk dikunjungi adalah taman yang bersih dan indah.
\[
\begin{array}{c}
p \rightarrow q \\
q \rightarrow r \\
\hline p \rightarrow r
\end{array}
\]

Jika taman \( X \) dipelihara dengan baik maka menarik untuk dikunjungi.

content:
Sebuah toko mengumumkan bahwa pada tengah malam diselenggarakan program khusus bagi pembeli, yaitu potongan harga atau bonus kupon belanja. Pada tengah malam, ternyata toko itu kehabisan persediaan kupon belanja.

Simpulan yang paling tepat adalah sebagai berikut.
answer:
Let's suppose
\( p \) : buyers get a discount.
\( q \) : buyers get a shopping coupon bonus.
From the problem we can write
Premise I : \( p \vee q \)
Premise II : \( \sim q \)
Conclusion : \( p \) (disjunctive syllogism)
raw_answer:
Misalkan
\( p \) : pembeli dapat potongan harga.
\( q \) : pembeli dapat bonus kupon belanja.
Dari soal dapat kita tulis
Premis I : \( p \vee q \)
Premis II : \( \sim q \)
Kesimpulan : \( p \) (silogisme disjungsi)

content:
Pimpinan meminta karyawan menyerahkan laporan kegiatan jika kegiatan telah dilaksanakan. Jika laporan kegiatan telah diserahkan, honor karyawan dibayarkan.

Simpulan yang paling tepat adalah sebagai berikut.
answer:
Let's suppose
\( p \) : the activity has been carried out
\( q \) : the leader asks employees to submit activity reports.
\( r \) : employee honorarium is paid.
From the problem, we can formulate
Premise I : \( p \rightarrow q \)
Premise II : \( q \rightarrow r \)
Conclusion : \( p \rightarrow r \) (syllogism)
or it's equivalent to contraposition
\[
p \rightarrow r \equiv \sim r \rightarrow \sim p
\]

So the conclusion is \( \sim r \rightarrow \sim p \)
If the employee's honorarium is not paid, it means the activity has not been carried out.
raw_answer:
Misalkan
\( p \) : kegiatan telah dilaksanakan
\( q \) : pimpinan meminta karyawan menyerahkan laporan kegiatan.
\( r \) : honor karyawan dibayarkan.
Dari soal dapat kita rumuskan
Premis I : \( p \rightarrow q \)
Premis II : \( q \rightarrow r \)
Kesimpulan : \( p \rightarrow r \) (silogisme)
atau ekuivalen dengan kontraposisi
\[
p \rightarrow r \equiv \sim r \rightarrow \sim p
\]

Jadi kesimpulannya \( \sim r \rightarrow \sim p \)
Jika honor karyawan tidak dibayar, artinya kegiatan belum dilaksanakan.

content: Jika suatu benda terbuat dari tembaga, benda itu bisa menghantarkan listrik dan panas. Kawat ini terbuat dan tembaga. Simpulan yang tepat adalah.
answer:
\[
\begin{array}{l}
p \implies q \\
p
\end{array}
\]

Kawat ini dapat mengalirkan panas dan listrik sebagai kesimpulan.
raw_answer:
\[
\begin{array}{l}
